intro: Morisonia humilis, commonly known as the small-flowered morisonia, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features delicate, yellow flowers with five petals and is often found in moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Morisonia humilis is typically short-lived and grows in open, sunny habitats.
